intro.description: This tutorial describes the basics of the Bioclipse workbench.

item.title: Step 1: Create a Project
item.description:
The Bioclipse Navigator (also known as the Bioclipse Explorer) is the central view in Bioclipse for working woth resources, such as files. By default it is located to the left in the workbench and points to a a special folder on the computer called the "Workspace", which is a special folder on your computer where all the data in Bioclipse is stored and accessed.
Everything listed in the Navigator is a Resource, and the top level Resources are called Projects which can contain folders and/or files. All files and folders need to be located in a Project. You can easily create new Projects, Folders, and Files by right-clicking in the Bioclipse Navigator.
Now, create a new General Project from the File< menu. Name the project "My Test Project".

item.title: Step 2: Create a new molecule
item.description:
Right-click on the created project in the Bioclipse Navigator, and select: New... Then select Molceule from Smiles.
Double-click the molecule to open it in JChemPaint Editor.

item.title: Step 6: Using Help
item.description:
In the Help menu, select "Help Contents". A browser window should open and reveal the Bioclipse online help. This is the main source for documentaion in Bioclipse.
Read the following tutorials (in "Bioclipse User Manual" -> 'Tutorials"):
* Getting started with Bioclipse
* External applications in Bioclipse
